raw: Exclusive: Coronavirus stalls Chinese approvals of new Brazil meat exports .

raw: BRASILIA ( Reuters ) - China has not approved any new Brazilian meat plants for export this year because of the coronavirus pandemic , an official at Brazil ’s Agriculture Ministry told Reuters , adding that all approvals were on hold until the crisis eases .
replaced: BRASILIA ( Reuters ) - China has not approved any new Brazilian meat plants for export this year because of the outbreak , an official at The ministry told Reuters , adding that Chinese approvals of new Brazil meat exports were on hold until the crisis eases .

raw: The freeze comes despite the fact that Brazil and China implemented a new system in January intended to speed up approvals , said Orlando Leite Ribeiro , international affairs secretary at Brazil ’s Agriculture Ministry .

raw: The ministry tried to get in touch with Chinese counterparts early this year to begin using the system , but at that time , as the coronavirus threat emerged , China ’s General Administration of Customs ( GACC ) was not working normally , Ribeiro said .
replaced: The ministry tried to get in touch with Chinese counterparts early this year to begin using The new system agreed in December , but at that time , as the coronavirus threat emerged , China ’s General Administration of Customs ( GACC ) was not working normally , Ribeiro said .

raw: Now that Brazil has been hit by the outbreak , many public employees are working from home to avoid spreading the novel coronavirus and associated COVID-19 disease , preventing the necessary meetings to gain new plant approvals , he said .
